You are responsible for your own actions. You can hope, you can pray, you can dream, and other forces have power over parts of your life, but if you don’t leave the house and make things happen they never will — and anything you do wrong, YOU did wrong.Do what matters to you and to those you love. You may have a bunch of stuff you have to do that matters to no one, including yourself, in order to get through life, but do not forget to take care of yourself in all things.Your perception is not shared. Everyone has their own map of what they want, what they need, and what to do to get them. You can help them follow their maps, just as they can help you with yours, but never ever forget that YOUR map only affects YOU and YOUR map isn’t THEIR map.Love yourself. It’s hard to accept or even receive other people’s care if you cannot find the value in You. It definitely helps you to share your love with others if you have a wellspring to work with.And the harshest truth that comes to me at this moment: A short-term win often leads to a long-term loss. Be wise in your choices and consider their future outcomes. Do not bank upon “I won’t be here when that wolf comes calling” because it eventually will come knocking — and if by some fate it doesn’t find you in life, it will find others you wouldn’t wish its company on.
